pvpumpingsystem is a tool aimed at simulating and sizing photovoltaic powered water pumping station. 
It is entirely written in Python, and relies on two other python packages that can be found on GitHub: 
pvlib/pvlib-python and CalebBell/fluids.
This package was originally developped at the Industrial Research Chair in energy technologies and energy 
efficiency (t3e), at the Ecole de Technologie Supérieure de Montréal.

The source code for pvpumpingsystem is hosted on `github <https://github.com/tylunel/pvpumpingsystem>`_.
